etymology.description: semantic: 見(見) (jiàn, "see") + phonetic: 瞿(瞿) (qú) = tool for seeing precise lines -> compass
etymology.interpretation: The character 規(規) (guī, "compass") combines the idea of seeing with precision, represented by 見(見) (jiàn, "see"), with the phonetic component 瞿(瞿) (qú) to form a character representing a tool for creating precise lines, such as a compass.

examples.chinese: 这个規指引着航海者找到方向(這個規指引著航海者找到方向)。
examples.pinyin: Zhège guī zhǐyǐn zhe hánghǎi zhě zhǎodào fāngxiàng.
examples.english: This compass guides the seafarers to find their direction.

examples.chinese: 迷路的水手依靠規(迷路的水手依靠規)，穿越惊涛骇浪(穿越驚濤駭浪)。
examples.pinyin: Mílù de shuǐshǒu yīkào guī, chuānyuè jīngtāo hàilàng.
examples.english: The lost sailor relies on the compass, braving the tumultuous waves.
